name: root
engine_repr: AnthropicEngine(client=<anthropic.AsyncAnthropic object at 0x7f3f0bbbbd50>, model='claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022', max_tokens=512, max_context_size=8192, hyperparams={'temperature': 0}, tokenizer=None)

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Out of the companies that have had exclusive Mountain Dew flavors that are no longer in production, which company has a headquarters in the largest city in terms of total population as of the 2020 census.

Out of the companies that have had exclusive Mountain Dew flavors that are no longer in production, which company has a headquarters in the largest city in terms of total population as of the 2020 census.

Let me help break this down and search for relevant information. I'll need to:
1. Find information about exclusive Mountain Dew flavors and their associated companies
2. Identify which companies had exclusive flavors that are now discontinued
3. Look up their headquarters locations
4. Compare the cities' populations

Let me start by searching for Mountain Dew flavors and partnerships:

Let me help break this down and search for relevant information. I'll need to:
1. Find information about exclusive Mountain Dew flavors and their associated companies
2. Identify which companies had exclusive flavors that are now discontinued
3. Look up their headquarters locations
4. Compare the cities' populations

Let me start by searching for Mountain Dew flavors and partnerships:

No page with that title exists. Try searching for one of these similar articles instead:
- List of Mountain Dew flavors and varieties
- Mountain Dew
- Cheetos
- Taco Bell
- McDonald's
- The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf
- Fritos
- Raising Cane's Chicken Fingers
- Big Boy Restaurants
- Lay's

msg.name: search

msg.content: Let me search specifically for Mountain Dew flavors:

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query": "List of Mountain Dew flavors and varieties"}

msg.content: Let me search specifically for Mountain Dew flavors:

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query": "List of Mountain Dew flavors and varieties"}

article_title: List of Mountain Dew flavors and varieties

msg.content:
<document>
<title>List of Mountain Dew flavors and varieties</title>
<fragment>
| Mountain Dew Johnson City Gold
 | 2012–13
 | A malt variant with lemon-lime named after Johnson City, Tennessee, that was test-marketed in August 2012 in the Chicago area, Denver, Colorado, and Charlotte, North Carolina.[88] Mountain Dew promised a return after 2013 after "Dew Fans" voted for names with six different kinds of cans for certain regions of the United States, named Liberty Malt, Southern Gold, Rusted Malt, Gold Mountain Malt, Great Plains Gold and Miner's Malt.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Cold Fusion
 | 2013–16
 | A cherry/lime Slurpee that was released in U.S. convenience stores, including Sheetz. It was discontinued in 2016 and is no longer listed as a flavor on their official website.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Game Fuel Electrifying Berry
 | 2013–14
 | A berry variant was released to coincide with the release of the video game *Ryse: Son of Rome* for the Xbox One.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Sangrita Blast
 | 2013–17 (fountain); 2015 (retail)

</fragment>
<fragment>

| Name
 | Dates of production
 | Exclusive to
 | Notes
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mountain Dew Berry Monsoon
 | 2018–present
 | Sam's Club | A berry lime variant exclusive to Sam's Club locations in May 2018 in the United States. It was released in limited quantities in the United States on June 28, 2018,[22] before becoming more widely available in stores in July.[23] Also available in zero sugar.
 |
| Mountain Dew Sweet Lightning
 | 2019–present
 | Kentucky Fried Chicken | A peach variant exclusive to KFC restaurants from late March 2019. It was first revealed via a trademark that was filed on March 4, 2019. Its tagline is "DEW charged with Natural & Artificial Sweet Peach & Smooth Honey".
 |
| Mountain Dew Maui Burst
 | 2019–present
 | Dollar General | A pineapple variant exclusive to Dollar General. Originally intended to be a limited-time flavor, it was re-released as a permanent flavor by popular demand in 2020, but still exclusive to Dollar General.[24] |
| Mountain Dew Frost Bite
 | 2020–present

</fragment>
<fragment>

| Name
 | Dates of production
 | Notes
 | Picture
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mountain Dew
 | 1940–present
 | A citrus-flavored soda developed in the 1940s by Barney and Ally Hartman, beverage bottlers in Tennessee. A revised formula was created by Bill Bridgforth in 1959. High-fructose corn syrup replaced sugar in the 1990s, though today there is a modified variant made with cane sugar known as Mountain Dew Real Sugar. A zero sugar variant was introduced in 2020. It is notable for including orange juice in the recipe.
 | ![](image) |
| Diet Mountain Dew | 1988–present
 | A low-calorie variant first introduced in 1988, replacing the similar drink "Sugar Free Mountain Dew".[1]
In 2006, Diet Mountain Dew was reformulated with a new "Tuned Up Taste", using a blend of sucralose, aspartame, and acesulfame potassium as sweeteners. The previous formulation was sweetened exclusively with aspartame.[2]
 | ![](image) |
| Diet Caffeine-Free Mountain Dew
 | 1989–present

</fragment>
<fragment>
Mountain Dew, a citrus-flavored carbonated soft drink now owned by PepsiCo, has had numerous branded flavor variants since the original formula's creation in 1940. Notable variants include Diet Mountain Dew, Baja Blast, Code Red, LiveWire, Voltage, Major Melon, and Spark.




## Flavors[edit]


### Current[edit]




</fragment>
<fragment>

| Name
 | Dates of production
 | Notes
 | Picture
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Caffeine-Free Mountain Dew
 | 1976–2021
 | A caffeine-free variant of the original Mountain Dew flavor. Discontinued in the United States as of 2021.[65]
Caffeine-free variants of Mountain Dew were also sold in Australia and Canada as the standard, but in March and June 2012, they were reformulated with caffeine as Mountain Dew "Energized" and "Citrus Charge", respectively.[66]
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Sport
 | 1989–91
 | A Mountain Dew-flavored sports drink that was released in a limited number of U.S. regions in 1990 following initial test marketing in 1989. A two-calorie variant was released, as well as a diet version. All were short-lived, being discontinued in 1991.[67] |  |
| Mountain Dew Pitch Black
 | 2004, 2011 (limited time release);
2016–2019 ("DEWcision"); 
2023 (limited time release)

</fragment>
<fragment>
 | Walmart | A honeydew/melon variant exclusive to Walmart stores, released in March 2020 as a permanent flavor.[25][26] A zero sugar variant was introduced in 2021.[27] |
| Mountain Dew Atomic Blue
 | 2020–present
 | Sheetz | An "electrifying lemonade" variant exclusive to select Sheetz and Kum & Go fountains released in May 2020.[28] |
| Mountain Dew Southern Shock
 | 2020–2022
 | Bojangles | A fruit punch variant exclusive to Bojangles.[29] |
| Dewgarita
 | 2020–2022
 | Red Lobster | A margarita made with Mountain Dew.[30][31] First official alcoholic Mountain Dew product.
 |
| Mountain Dew Vibe
 | 2021–present
 | Which Wich? | A lemon variant exclusive to Which Wich restaurants.[32] |
| Mountain Dew Thrashed Apple
 | 2021–present
 | Kroger family of stores
 | A crisp apple variant exclusive to Kroger-owned stores released in September 2021.[33][34] |
| Mountain Dew Uproar
 | 2021–2023
 | Food Lion | A strawberry-kiwi variant exclusive to Food Lion.[35][36] |
| Mountain Dew Dark Berry Bash
 | 2021–present

</fragment>
<fragment>
60. **^** "Mtn Dew". PepsiCo beverage facts. 30 March 2012. Archived from the original on 28 March 2012. Retrieved 8 April 2012.
61. **^** Kimberley, Sara (18 May 2010). "Mountain Dew returns (to UK) with social media push". *Brand Republic (U.K.)*. Archived from the original on 22 July 2010. Retrieved 27 January 2011.
62. **^** "Mountain Dew Energy fuels gamers with new promotion". Talkingretail.com. 2012-08-20. Archived from the original on 21 January 2013. Retrieved 18 February 2013.
63. **^** "PepsiCo India - Mountain Dew Fuels Gaming Culture In India". PepsiCo India. 9 June 2016. Archived from the original on 5 January 2018. Retrieved 4 January 2018.
64. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "Make your choice: Do the Dewmocracy". 12 August 2016. Archived from the original on 14 September 2016. Retrieved 4 September 2016.
65. **^** "PepsiCo on Twitter". *Twitter*. Retrieved 2022-05-04.

</fragment>
<fragment>
 | A limited production tangy grape Slurpee flavor.[71] It was available exclusively at 7-Eleven stores as part of a promotion for the theatrical release of *Star Wars Episode III*.[72] |  |
| Mountain Dew MDX
 | 2005–07
 | A Mountain Dew-flavored energy soda introduced in 2005 in 14-US-fluid-ounce (410 ml) bottles.[73] In 2006, its packaging was changed to 20-US-fluid-ounce (590 ml) bottles.[74] Its production was discontinued in 2007.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Revolution
 | 2008
 | A wild berry-flavored Mountain Dew with ginseng.[75] One of the three "candidate flavor" finalists for DEWmocracy's "People's Dew" national vote. Revolution initially held the highest number of votes until the end of the promotion when it dropped to 3rd place and lost to Mountain Dew Voltage.[76] In 2011, the "Mountain Dew Throwback Shack" offered a prize of "a hidden stash of Dew" which was revealed to be glass bottles of Revolution with lab labels on them.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Supernova
 | 2008, 2011

</fragment>
<fragment>
In mid-2019, it was re-released as a permanent flavor in certain regions but was quickly discontinued at the same time ICE was discontinued in early 2020.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew White Out
 | 2010–2020
 | A smooth citrus variant part of the "DEWmocracy: Collective Intelligence" promotion with a limited release starting on April 19, 2010. Voting ended on June 14, and White Out won the campaign with 44% of the votes. It became a permanent flavor and was officially released that October. A Diet White Out was created for the FanDEWmonium promotion, which came in third place.
Discontinued in the United States as of April 2020,[100] although still produced by some independent bottlers in the Midwest. Received a limited run in Canada in the summer of 2022.
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Merry Mash-Up
 | 2018, 2019, 2020
 | A holiday-themed cranberry/pomegranate flavor.[101][102] |  |
| Mountain Dew Liberty Brew
 | 2019, 2020
 | A fruit-flavored variant.[103] Described as "50 flavors in one".[104] |  |
| Mountain Dew Baja Punch

</fragment>
<fragment>

| Name
 | Dates of production
 | Notes
 |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Hard Mountain Dew
 | 2022–present
 | An alcoholic variant developed with the Boston Beer Company.[53] Alcoholic version of the original Mountain Dew flavor. Contains 5% alcohol by volume and has no caffeine or sugar. Soft-launched in February 2022 in Iowa, Tennessee, and Florida.
 |
| Hard Mountain Dew Black Cherry
 | 2022–present
 | A black cherry alcoholic variant.[53] Contains 5% alcohol by volume and has no caffeine or sugar. Soft-launched in February 2022 in Iowa, Tennessee, and Florida.
 |
| Hard Mountain Dew Watermelon
 | 2022–present
 | A watermelon alcoholic variant.[53] Contains 5% alcohol by volume and has no caffeine or sugar. Soft-launched in February 2022 in Iowa, Tennessee, and Florida.
 |
| Hard Mountain Dew Baja Blast
 | 2022–present

</fragment>
<fragment>
 | An orange variant introduced in 2003 as a limited-edition flavor for the summer.[8] In 2005, after two years of limited summer releases, it became a permanent addition to the product line.[9] |  |
| Mountain Dew Voltage | 2008–present
 | A blue raspberry/citrus variant with ginseng. It is the winner of the first DEWmocracy promotion and was released in 2008.
 | ![](image) |
| Mountain Dew Voo-DEW
 | 2019-present (fall only)
 | An annually released mystery-flavored Mountain Dew released for the Halloween season.
In 2019, the flavor was revealed to be candy corn at the end of its scheduled release.
2020's mystery flavor was described as "fruit candy explosion".
In 2021, the year's mystery flavor was announced as "fruit candy chews".[10]
From 2022 onwards, the flavor has additionally been made available in zero sugar. 2022's mystery flavor was revealed to be "sour candy flavor".[11]
In 2023, the flavor was revealed to be flavored after cherry Airheads candy, as part of a partnership with the candy brand.[12]

</fragment>
<fragment>
88. **^** "PepsiCo to test malt-flavored Mountain Dew in some U.S. cities". *Reuters*. 13 July 2012. Archived from the original on 21 October 2012. Retrieved 14 July 2012.
89. **^** Stampler, Laura (17 January 2014). "You're Not Ready for Taco Bell's Mountain Dew Sangria". Archived from the original on 30 January 2014. Retrieved 28 January 2014.
90. **^** "'Fuel Up for Battle' with Mountain Dew®, Doritos® and Call of Duty®: Advanced Warfare". Archived from the original on 13 October 2014. Retrieved 30 May 2015.
91. **^** "'Dewitos': Pepsi Tests Doritos-Flavored Mountain Dew on College Students". *syracuse.com*. 2014-11-08. Archived from the original on 7 May 2015. Retrieved 30 May 2015.
92. **^** Quartz, Svati Kirsten Narula (2014-11-09). "Why, Why Is Pepsi Testing Doritos-Flavored Mountain Dew?". *The Atlantic*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
93. **^** Horovitz, Bruce. "Mountain Dew to roll out craft DEWshine". *USA TODAY*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.

</fragment>
<fragment>
6. **^** Tanner, Steve (7 January 2011). "Pepsi, Dew Throwback return in 2011 for 4th limited run, perhaps extended beyond 8 weeks". *BevReview*. Archived from the original on 14 January 2011. Retrieved 27 January 2011.
7. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "The votes are in: Brands give consumers a voice in product flavor decisions". *Food Dive*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
8. **^** "Pepsi to Electrify Summer with 'Mountain Dew Livewire'" (Press release). PR Newswire. 25 February 2003. Archived from the original on 4 September 2010. Retrieved 1 February 2011.
9. **^** Tanner, Steve (29 March 2005). "Update: Mountain Dew LiveWire". *BevReview*. Archived from the original on 7 July 2011. Retrieved 1 February 2011.
10. **^** "MTN DEW Voodew 2021 Flavor Has Been Revealed". *FoodSided*. 2021-10-22. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
11. **^** "2022 MTN DEW VOO-DEW flavor shakes up spooky and sweet for Halloween". *FoodSided*. 2022-10-31. Retrieved 2022-11-01.

</fragment>
<fragment>

| Name
 | Dates of production
 | Notes
 |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Mountain Dew Blue Shock Freeze
 | 2001–present
 | A raspberry/citrus variant.[58] Blue Shock was initially test-marketed in Chicago, but when sales did not meet expectations, it was released in 2002 in the U.S. exclusively as a Slurpee at 7-Eleven.
 |
| Mountain Dew Electric Charge
 | 2014–present
 | A sour lemon variant released in U.S. convenience stores, including Sheetz.
 |
| Mountain Dew Game Fuel Berry Lime
 | 2015–present
 | A berry/lime variant exclusively at 7-Eleven stores.
 |


### International variations[edit]




</fragment>
<fragment>
40. **^** "Mountain Dew's Newest Soda Is Pitch Black". *KGUN*. 2022-03-06. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
41. **^** Ramsay, G. (2022-05-19). "Buffalo Wild Wings Unveils New Legendary Long Island Made With Mountain Dew Legend". *The Fast Food Post*. Retrieved 2022-05-28.
42. **^** Miller, Bob (2022-05-18). "New Mountain Dew Legend Available Exclusively At Buffalo Wild Wings". *Chew Boom*. Retrieved 2022-05-28.
43. **^** "Circle K® and MTN DEW® Invite DEW Nation to "Taste the Open Road" With Its Latest Drink Innovation, MTN Dew® Purple Thunder™". *www.businesswire.com*. 2022-05-04. Retrieved 2022-05-04.
44. **^** Pomranz, Mike (May 4, 2022). "Mtn Dew Releases New Purple Flavor — But You Can Only Find It at One Convenience Store Chain". *Food & Wine*. Retrieved 2022-05-04.
45. **^** Pomranz, Mike (June 14, 2022). "Mtn Dew Is Releasing Another Exclusive Flavor and It's Only at Casey's". *Food & Wine*. Retrieved 2022-06-15.

</fragment>
<fragment>

| Name
 | Dates of production
 | Notes
 |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Mountain Dew Kickstart Orange Citrus
 | 2013–present
 | An orange variant released on February 25, 2013, advertised to have caffeine and electrolytes to provide energy for the morning. This flavor was available as a fountain drink at Taco Bell locations. Mountain Dew Kickstart Orange Citrus appeared in Australian stores in April 2017.
 |
| Mountain Dew Kickstart Fruit Punch
 | 2013–present
 | A fruit punch variant released on February 25, 2013, advertised to have caffeine, B vitamins, and electrolytes to provide energy for the morning.
 |
| Mountain Dew Kickstart Black Cherry
 | 2014–present

</fragment>
<fragment>
32. **^** "MTN Dew Reveals New Lemonade Flavor". *IRL*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
33. **^** "MTN DEW Launches THRASHED APPLE Available Exclusively At The Kroger Family Of Companies". *BevNET.com*. 2021-09-08. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
34. **^** Lamoureux, Aimee (2021-09-07). "Mountain Dew's New Apple Flavor Is Coming To Kroger Stores". *Mashed.com*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
35. **^** "Mountain Dew Just Introduced A New Uproar Flavor That Sounds Like A Cocktail In The Making". *MSN*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
36. **^** "MTN DEW Reveals New Berry-Kiwi Flavor". *IRL*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.
37. **^** Gupta, Boshika (2021-08-24). "The Mountain Dew Flavor You Can Only Find At Applebee's - Mashed". *Mashed.com*. Retrieved 2022-04-21.
38. **^** "Cosmic Wings® Expands Reach with DoorDash and Grubhub to Deliver Out-of-this-World Cheetos® Menu of Wings, Cheese Bites & More Nationwide". *finance.yahoo.com*. Retrieved 2022-04-21.
39. **^** "New Blackberry MTN DEW Revealed by Buffalo Wild Wings". *IRL*. Retrieved 2022-03-09.

</fragment>
<fragment>
 | 2023 (limited time release)
 | Limited-time summer flavor inspired by the taste of a bomb pop, with cherry, raspberry and lemon flavors. Also available in zero sugar.[114][115] |  |
| Mountain Dew Baja Caribbean Splash
 | 2023 (limited time release)
 | Flavor in the Baja Blast line, described as "Dew with a blast of natural and artificial guava flavor"
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Baja Passionfruit Punch
 | 2023 (limited time release)
 | Flavor in the Baja Blast line, described as "Dew with a blast of natural and artificial passionfruit flavor"
 |  |
| Mountain Dew Red
 | 1988
 | This flavor was described as tasting like fruit punch. This was the first new flavor other then the original citrus.
 |  |


## See also[edit]


* List of citrus soft drinks
* Surge


## References[edit]


</fragment>
</document>

 | A blue raspberry/citrus variant with ginseng. It is the winner of the first DEWmocracy promotion and was released in 2008.
 | ![](image) |
| Mountain Dew Voo-DEW
 | 2019-present (fall only)
 | An annually released mystery-flavored Mountain Dew released for the Halloween season.
In 2019, the flavor was revealed to be candy corn at the end of its scheduled release.
2020's mystery flavor was described as "fruit candy explosion".
In 2021, the year's mystery flavor was announced as "fruit candy chews".[10]
From 2022 onwards, the flavor has additionally been made available in zero sugar. 2022's mystery flavor was revealed to be "sour candy flavor".[11]
In 2023, the flavor was revealed to be flavored after cherry Airheads candy, as part of a partnership with the candy brand.[12]

msg.name: search

msg.content:
From my research:

1. Red Lobster's headquarters is in Orlando, Florida
2. Bojangles' headquarters is in Charlotte, North Carolina
3. Food Lion's headquarters is in Salisbury, North Carolina

Comparing the 2020 populations of these cities:
- Orlando, FL: 307,573
- Charlotte, NC: 874,579
- Salisbury, NC: 35,540

Among the companies that had exclusive Mountain Dew flavors that are now discontinued, Bojangles, headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, has its headquarters in the largest city by population as of the 2020 census. Charlotte's population of 874,579 is significantly larger than both Orlando and Salisbury.

Therefore, Bojangles is the answer to your question. They had the exclusive Mountain Dew Southern Shock flavor from 2020-2022, and their headquarters is in Charlotte, NC, which is the largest city among the companies that had discontinued exclusive Mountain Dew flavors.
